reviews.review_msg: Guillaume is the best teacher you'll ever have. He gives the most amazing and thoughtful feedback on assignments, which is guaranteed to greatly improve your writing skills across just one semester. His comments are always constructive, detailed, and encouraging, helping you grow not just as a student, but as a thinker. He is simply fabulous.

The texts chosen for this class were clearly chosen from a place of love, and if you too love queer feminist literature you need to take this class. His expectations for the writing assignments are quite high, as far as structure goes, but he gives ample time, so definitely take advantage of office hours! Give this man an award.

Very kind-hearted person. Class near-identical to FREN245 structure-wise (not Jorge woo!). As a trans person, way too much of the material is queer-focused and now boring. You can do well on the other 90% of the class (1800 words total lol) without attending at all, making worrying about participation not really necessary for a good B to B+ grade.

He is such a sweet person, is always available, and provides feedback to students when asked. If you are into Qu√©becois literature and theatre pieces, then take this course. Unfortunately for me, I was not a fan. I also wasn't not a fan of his assignments too, which were basically the same ones in 245, but longer and his marking was more critical.

The homework (ungraded) consists of weekly readings with questions and sometimes an additional paragraph to be written as practice for the upcoming take-home writes. These were discussed in-class (participation = 10%). I recommend doing the practice paragraphs, then asking for feedback in his office hours. He's very kind, and I enjoyed his class.
Really nice guy who is willing to help correct and go over your papers before handing them in. There's a lot of homework, but it is supposed to help you with your POL classes.
He was a great teacher and helps you a lot when you ask him questions.
Didn't feel comfortable in the class, he's an alright teacher just doesn't make the lecture as interesting as it could be.
